titleStmt.title: A cleere and full vindication of the late proceedings of the armie under the conduct of his Excellencie Sir Thomas Fairfax, by certain positions, built upon principles and grounds both of religion and sound reason. Wherein the power of the magistrate is stated and bounded, and the just liberty and priviledge of the people asserted, in point of civill government.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for William Larnar, and are to be sold at his shop at the signe of the Black-Moore in Bishops-gate street.,

notesStmt.note: Imperfect; trimmed at fore-edge, affecting text.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
